Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: kristenstravels
Reviews.Content: Beach Haven Inn is a cozy little beach motel right around the corner from the beach, my boyfriend and I stayed for four nights in December and we loved it. As we left we said we would definitely stay at Beach Haven the next time we were in San Diego. Larger hotels/resorts may have more amenities, however, we loved so many more things about Beach Haven, being able to park right next to the room, we loved the size of the rooms, a fully stocked kitchen with fridge and oven/stove, the separate bedroom and the living room with the sleeper sofa...it was all just perfect! It was quiet, had a pool and a hot tub. We could hear the waves from outside and walked to the beach at night to see the waves coming in, it was beautiful. Thank you Beach Haven Inn, we look forward to our next stay with you!!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: gaiatourist
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying @ Beach Haven Inn. Haven't had a problem with cleanliness. Not too fancy but well appointed and awesome location & toasty hot tub- I love a toasty hot tub. The rooms are spacious & we booked the suite with kitchen; really nice. Totally will stay here again. If you want upscale stay @ the Catamaran but you'll pay more than double, although it is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Trying elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: CotijaBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Haven Inn for a weekend trip. It was one of the less inexpensive hotel on Pacific beach. The area is fun with lots of bars, caters to a younger crowd. But this hotel needed some serious updating. Our check-in took forever. 50 minutes. The person checking us in was running around doing other things at the same time, and telling us really useless information, like the city wanted to install parking meters on the street in the future. Really? We're only staying a few days. The rooms were not very clean. The beds seemed ok, but the shower really needed some work. I didn't want to look too closely at the shower seams, because there was some black stuff there. We were with friends who had another room, and they said they had a real gnats problem. We were told our rooms were "updated", so I'd hate to see what the non-updated rooms looked like. FYI, the room did not look "updated" at all, unless what they meant by updating was to paint it and put a new mirror on the wall. However, the beds were comfortable, and seemed clean. There is no "continental breakfast" as was stated-- it's just hot water and coffee. Most motel places will at least give you a packaged roll or an apple. When we stayed it was really noisy at night. Not the hotel's fault because it is on Pacific Beach, but something you may want to be aware of. Our door was broken so we couldn't open it from the inside (uh, fire hazard!). Our friends had to let us out of our own room. They did fix it the next day though. The rooms are quite cramped. Not much shelving space to put your stuff down. Obviously, I was not paying for 5 stars, but I did have the minimal standards of cleanliness and efficient service. I don't think Beach Haven Inn met these standards this time.

Reviews.Title: “50 yds to beach, close to shopping & restaurants, yet quaint & quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mike_TV_Producer
Reviews.Content: Great mix of reasonable price for the location, easy access (don't need a car unless leaving the beach area). Off street parking. Clean, well kept - BIG suite. Small pool, but the beach is like 50 yards away. Responsive, friendly, knowledgeable desk staff. NOT a "party" hotel. Bike & surf board rentals nearby. Would highly recommend in the Pacific Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: redryderbkr
Reviews.Content: 7/11/11 - 7/16/11 My wife and I stayed a wonderful five nights at Beach Haven Inn. Considered a budget priced accommodation, the building is obviously older, though it is quite apparent they take pride in what they have to offer their guests and have made repairs and upgrades as needed. Our room was clean and we slept well on our comfortable bed. The large shower had no problems with hot water or water pressure. The pool and hot tube are well kept and clean. We found all the staff to be polite and friendly. One of our main considerations when choosing Beach Haven Inn was location, and we were not disappointed! It is about two minutes walking distance to the beach and the boardwalk, and is on Mission Blvd. with its shopping, restaurants and nightlife. We found no need to use our vehicle the six days we were there. We recommend that if you are looking for a clean, comfortable, friendly and convenient place to stay, while visiting Pacific Beach & Mission Beach, that is also well priced for the area, then Beach Haven Inn should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: sandi1149
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. The staff is great. Left a sweatshirt in room, they called to tell me about it right away and they mailed it that day. What Service! On the 4th the maintenance man was barbecuing Hot Dogs on the outside grill and made some for my teenagers. Thought that was so nice!! I have stayed here twice now, and each time it has been a nice experience. The price is good for how close you are to the beach (1/2 blk), there is parking which is hard to come by in San Diego. Its not a fancy place, but very clean, so if you are looking for fancy and expensive go somewhere else. Tthey are very nice and helpful, kitchenettes are great (I would recommend getting that) and it is close to beach and alot of activities and restaurants. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly, great renovation, cozy not corporate”
Reviews.Author: home86
Reviews.Content: We visited Beach Haven in San Diego many years ago, and have come back every year since-- it just keeps getting better and better. They are renovating the place room by room, and now the pool and hot tub are finished, as well as the room we stayed in- 108. Nice to visit a place with consistent owners who care, and it shows. Super sleek and clean kitchen, separate bedroom, plus a comfortable new pull out couch bed for the kids in the living area. It is a small complex with a courtyard pool, historic vibe, cozy not corporate. Hot tub is actually HOT, unlike most places, and the pool was favorite with the kids. Great location, half block from beach access, kitchen in room saves on restaurant $$. (Phoenix family)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: raven2122
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, pool, and just off the beach. Room had great large TV, stove all the items in a small apartment. This is not the Hilton but I didnt pay the HIlton price. Cant wait for my next trip to the Beach Haven.

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto”
Reviews.Author: kvaldespino12
Reviews.Content: They were extremely rude and unprofessional. The rooms were dirty so many things were broken. There was a blood stain on my mattress!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: gaiatourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a girlfriend to be near family. Very lovely little place- yes quite simple but our room was clean & convenient. The bathroom was pretty outdated but everything functioned & was clean. The best part were the heated pool & hot tub- made use of those big time. Only thing maybe to consider is that the reasonable price DOES attract college folks & if it's a holiday week-end they can be noisy. Will mosdef stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Haven Inn... SUCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: ariz0na20_10
Reviews.Content: One of the front desk guys were very rude!!! Room was not cleaned... the place was falling apart... the pics on the internet are def not what it looks like when you get there!!! the only good thing about this place was the location was close to the beach...

Reviews.Title: “the worst place i have ever stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: oockiki
Reviews.Content: my friends and i stayed here for a fun weekend at the beach and wish we would have stayed somewhere else. i think the people who ran it may have sold their souls to satan. a group of friends staying in another room, tv was stolen. we were all at the pool bbq-ing and the manager comes up and says to the other people we were with that their tv was stolen. they didn't even know it was gone so how did the manager??? i think they have a fishy operation going on there. also we when we checked in the day manager picked up a spider from the floor and started to talk to it. we had not even been in our room for 5 mins. and the manager called us up and asked if our friend who was in our room was staying with us because we only specified 3 people and not 4. he basically accused us and then we had to pay for her. she was going to a wedding that nite but he did not believe us. they also called the cops on us becuase a couple of guy friends were hanging out in our room for bit in the evening. the first question the cop asked was if we had boys in the room. it was ridiculous. before we left i took pics of the room to make sure they did not accuse us of messing up the place. the worst hotel experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Wonderful Staff, Great "Value" for Area”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorSt_Paul
Reviews.Content: The Beach Haven Inn is a wonderful place to stay if you are looking for a great value within a half-block of the beach. Granted, this place is an older facility, but the entire staff is very friendly and hard working. The pool area is cozy and comfortable for relaxing. If you absolutely need a beach view, then go ahead and pay 10-20 times the nightly rate elsewhere. If you are looking for an older (but nice) clean place to stay, then choose the Beach Haven Inn! Many nice and inexpensive restaurants and grocery options are nearby. The location is terrific. Public transportation to and from the airport and downtown is right out the door. We hope to return next February in an effort to escape Minnesota cold and snow....

Reviews.Title: “Not like some of the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: daytripperTucsonAZ
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location and price. It was in the center of everything and from the parking lot you can see the ocean. The room was clean and we had everything we needed. It was mostly quiet. In response to some of the bad reviews.....we came here to see the beach and not to hang out at our hotel, otherwise we could have gotten a room at the Sheraton here in Tucson. For the price and location, it was adequate and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price - no ocean view, old, but okay”
Reviews.Author: badbarn9
Reviews.Content: Not as nice as the pictures, but okay. Pool and hot tub were dirty, but they cleaned them later in the week and it was okay. Room was interesting. Lots of updates. Had a nice flat panel tv (about 32") and nice bed, mattress, shower enclosure, etc. But walls and doors had paint peeling and the walls actually had some of the framework sticking out in the bathroom. Blinds are about 2" short of covering the window. I paid the extra $10 for the kitchen, which was worth it. But it has a 2 dutch ovens, but no regular sauce pans to cook with. It also had no matches for the gas stove, which you needed to light the burner. Had 3 kitchen chairs and 1 sort of a side chair at the old table. Rooms are noisy on the weekends, but they have a lot of vacancy, so it's not a problem during the week. 1/2 block to the beach. Great location. But you'd have to look through a building to see water. The guy at the front desk was nice. I'd probably stay here again, since it's hard to get anything under $100 here. But my next visit is at another place nearby to see how that looks. I bet this was a great place in 1960 when it was fairly new.

Reviews.Title: “Worst part of my trip”
Reviews.Author: TATATraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on hotels.com. The rooms looked decent and somewhat remodeled per the pictures on the Beach Haven Inn website and hotels.com. We were quite upset to find that our "suite" was a normal room with two uncomfortable queen size beds, a 19" TV on the wall, and a very small bathroom (only a simple vanity sink, toilet and shower; which all needed much repair). The room looked like it had not been painted in a decade. Several drywall patches were needed throughout the room and very much needed in the bathroom. The beds looked like they were bought at a garage sale in the 90's. The beds didnt even match, one was shorter than the other. Not that it matters, it just was very tacky looking. I asked the front desk for additional towels and they responded, "Are your current towels dirty?" instead of, "Sure, how many do you need." The location was nice but there are several other nice hotels in the area that I would stay at on my next visit. I would suggest this room to people who are on a very tight budget and don't care about the quality of the room or service.

Reviews.Title: “ood location to enjoy the beach and its nightlife”
Reviews.Author: amendola_mario
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiete complex of small apartments with swimming pool. We stayed in 5, using 1 bed and 2 coaches. Coaches were quite old and uncomfortable (it's like sleeping on a bed of nails), the bed was big and comfortable. Bathroom clean and fairly big, daily service. Although we did not use the kitchen, everything was there, including a table for 4/6 people, and the fridge was working. the location (Pacific Beach), very close to the beach, you can walk with the surfboard under the arm. By night the walking area is livelyand young, but safe. Receptionists were kind and helpful. The price was good, we paied about 120 $/ day in total.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service - Disgusting Room”
Reviews.Author: Cheapdata
Reviews.Content: Had the unfortunate pleasure to stay at the Beach Haven Inn - Day Manager was very rude and condecending. I heard him making racial remarks towards a minority guest. Room was disgusting. Stained carpet - moldy bathroom. Stained bed spread. Do your self a favor and stay elsewhere. This place is nothing like the photos presented on the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal to surf in san diego”
Reviews.Author: ferdinando_pucci
Reviews.Content: Nice complex of small apartments with swimming pool and laundry. We stayed in 5, using 1 bed and 2 coaches. Coaches were quite uncomfortable, the bed was very ok. Bathroom clean and fairly big, daily service. Kitchen was present althought we didn't use it. Fridge was working. Located in Pacific Beach, very close to the beach, you can walk with the surfboard under the arm. By night the area is lively but safe. Receptionists were kind.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: ikukoto
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Beach Haven Inn just after memorial day 2009. The pics on the website looked pretty good and the prices were reasonable. When we checked in, we were ignored by the arrogant manager for a good 10 minutes. Then we were told that we would have to pay an extra $20.00 per day because my kids were older than 12 yrs. When we got to the room I was shocked to see the 70`s shag carpet with disgusting stains all over it. 'The floor was so noisy and creaky, I thought every one in the place could here me tiptoe across the room. One spot on the floor literally felt like it was going to fall through. This place needs to be torn down!! We often stay in P.B. at a nearby hotel. We thought we would save a little money this year. NOT!! Shop around, this place should be avoided at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is all you get at this place!”
Reviews.Author: cpa793
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I start. First off my fiancee is a diabetic so we confirmed with hotel that there was a fridge in the room. When we arrived and opened the fridge it wasn't working and someone left yogurt in it that was spoiled and the smell was horrible. We went to front desk and they said they didn't have another room to put us in but said they could keep her insulin in the office fridge. The next morning when we went to get it they couldn't find it!!! They acted like we were a burden and were not friendly or apologetic at all! There were dirty towels on the bathroom floor when we arrived, the heater didnt work, the bed was "damp" we had to sleep on top of the blankets we brought so we didn't feel like we were laying in a wet bed, and there was sand everywhere and on everything. Now I expect a cheap room in a great location like this to be serviceable at best but it seemed like the previous people checked out and housekeepin did nothing but make the beds and empty the trash. Room was next to alley that was full of overflowing dumpsters, the pool wasn't heated and it was hard to find parking... We love Pacific Beach but couldn't wait to get out of this place. I stayed here 3 times in the last 2 years and I guess management has changed in the past 9 months and it has gone downhill fast!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and comfortable, and great price!”
Reviews.Author: sunloverSouthernCa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites for three nights. This was the first time in the area for my daughter, son in law, and two year old granddaughter. We were all very pleased with the location. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The kitchen was very convenient especially with the little granddaughter. We used the pool and jacuzzi. It was a wonderful weekend. We would recommend the suite for extended family. Worked out great for the 3 1/2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Room Okay, Absolutely Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: hatesfascists
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at numerous hotels in multiple cities throughout the country, including New York, Boston, San Francisco, Las Vegas, and Los Angeles, but I've never encountered worse service than the Beach Haven Inn in San Diego. Here are the facts, feel free to make your own conclusions: 1. Check-in involved an uncomfortable 20-minute interrogation with the manager about why I was in town and what I was planning on doing in the room. Even though it wasn't his business, I told him I was 'in town for the beach' and 'sleeping in the room'. 2. The hotel lacked the proper billing paperwork from Expedia. Even though they had my reservation, they messed up the billing with Expedia and threatened to charge me again for the room if they couldn't work it out (i.e. punishing me for their own incompetence). Luckily, Expedia was helpful with this and the matter eventually got resolved. 3. A friend from La Jolla showed up to hang out with us at the beach during the day, and the manager yelled at me as we walked by the office because he saw 3 people although I only booked a room for 2. Again, even though it was none of his business, I explained that our friend was just meeting us there and we were on our way to the beach. He angrily told me that we would be charged an extra person fee if my friend was in the hotel room for more than an hour (I would have enjoyed seeing where in the room agreement this policy was stated). The maid-service was great and the rooms weren't bad, but I'll never consider paying money to stay under a Fascist-regime again.

Reviews.Title: “ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: Butchtucson
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel and reserved two rooms connected by the kitchenette, I was very specific. The clerk gave me a conf # and told me which rooms would be ours. Upon arrival, the said no reservations. Faced with conf # and other details, they admitted error. they scrambled to find us another place for the night, We had to move back to Beach haven next day only to find they still had no rooms like we ordered, We stayed in a terrible room that night and moved again the next day, again to rooms that were nothing like we ordered. The rooms were falling apart and dirty. The kitchenette had no utensils and instead of 2 queen beds, we got a pull out couch! very uncomfortable. We used to stay here every summer, about 5 years ago, we will never come back. We had to pack up and move 3 days out of a 5 day stay. I hate this place

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Pacific Beach! Cozy and charming!”
Reviews.Author: fuji1235
Reviews.Content: We brought my Mom and Dad to the Beach Haven Inn for a weekend getaway. I was impressed from the moment I walked in. The staff welcomed us with open arms! You don't get that in San Diego! We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was spacious and comfortable for us. We grilled by the pool and had a relaxing time. We all felt as if we were at home with family; the manager went above and beyond the call of duty. We had requested a wine opener, she immediately went out to purchase one for us; now that is service!! The location is fabulous for the price! The property was older but clean. We enjoyed early morning walks to the beach and watching the sun go down was beautiful. We love the Beach Haven Inn and will return later this year.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Beach Haven Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: ronnie431
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed July 4th weekend at Beach Haven Inn. The location was awesome. The staff was second to none! I feel they went above and beyond for myself and my family to make us feel welcomed and comfortable. The property is older but very clean. The pool and spa area was amazing. We spent most of our time there. If you plan to visit Pacific Beach, the place to stay is the Beach Haven Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it looks from the outside!”
Reviews.Author: weezerific
Reviews.Content: I live about 2 blocks away from the Beach Haven Inn, so when my dad came down to visit, I tried to find him a cheap room nearby. From the street (and if you don't look closely), the Beach Haven Inn looks like a cute little hotel, and it always is busy in the summers. It also was less thatn $100/night, which is unusual in San Diego. Well, it's not as cute/nice as it looks from the street. The building/rooms are in desparate need of a new coat of paint, as well as new furniture. The room was a decent size, and clean (I actually talked to the housekeeping two different days, and I think they were really making an effort to keep it clean). But man, does this place need renovating. The bathroom was tiny, and flooded every day. The ceiling had major water damage, and the sink/cabinet was so old the door kept falling off, and also leaked. If this place was better maintained, it would be a nice little hotel in a great location...unfortunately, it isn't!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Suite at the Beach Haven Inn in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: pbmermaid
Reviews.Content: We moved from San Diego's Pacific Beach 2 years ago and were excited to visit this January to see old friends. Knowing we would have lots of visitors, we book a two room suite at the Beach Haven Inn. Pacific Beach is a little funky in places and we are comfortable with that. We were not comfortable with what we found in our â€œsuite". Upon entering we saw a stained, cigarette burned sofa bed that I chose not to sit on or touch. Checking out the bedroom we discovered that the queen bed took up over 95% of the room. Since it was a four poster bed with rails for a canopy (minus the fabric) it was almost impossible to squeeze between the wall and the foot of the bed to reach the other side so we spent the weekend crawling over each other to get in and out and trying to avoid the stained, cigarette burnt blankets. I ended up with a rash everywhere my skin was exposed to the sheets. The kitchen was another special surprise. The faucet was functional although it was missing its handle. We had no ice bucket for the ice machine and resorted to using the carafe from the coffee pot since it didn't work. The original built in mini fridge was rusted and broken and had been replaced with a new fridge which was the only new thing in the whole unit. The glasses, silverware and dishes in the cub bard and drawers were not what you would consider clean. The some of the amenities in the bathroom were partially used. There were of course not additional rooms available. This was a horrible trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, great location”
Reviews.Author: letmeseetheworld
Reviews.Content: The Beach Haven Inn is by no means glamorous but I stayed there with 6 friends and I found it comfortable and it has a great location. It's right on the beach in the vibrant area of Pacific Beach. The rooms are old but the beds are cozy & the place is clean. We stayed on the first floor and we had to drag our cases up a flight of steps which was annoying! There is a small pool but we didn't use it as we were right by the beach. The place is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Just say NO! Outdated and dumpy!”
Reviews.Author: kellycrew1
Reviews.Content: We almost stayed at the Beach Haven but checked out the room BEFORE we checked in. Well, we never checked in! The room was dark and stinky. The cabinets were caving in and the chairs looked like they were from 1960! When I booked it said the rooms were renvoated, and when I complained they said that some rooms were renovated, but that it was 1st come, 1st serve. Now I know why were are NO refunds if you check out early and you have to cancel 3 days in advance. Because if you saw the place, you wouldn't stay! We stayed at the Diamond Head Inn around the corner, closer to the beach, and renovated for the same price Beach Haven was charging. What a rip-off. They should be ashamed of themselves!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lec510
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two room suite with a kitchen, but the bedroom did not have an a/c unit or a television, so no TV in bed. The furniture and fixtures were from the early 70's. Our bathroom sink was stopped up and had standing water for the first two days we were there. The question seemed to be "where's Waldo?" who was the plumber on site. The promised continental breakfast was absent 3 of 4 mornings even though we went to the office by 8am. The worst problem was the paper thin walls and wooden floors. A drunken fight broke out at the pool at 3am and went on and on. Every curse word and stomp could be heard from our room. The manager onsite was the only person who didn't hear the noise! The only good thing about this hotel was the location. We would NEVER consider staying here again. Not worth the $215/night.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and unsanitary”
Reviews.Author: jen1255
Reviews.Content: Disgusting!!! Piss on toilet seat. Room smelt like piss. The most unsanitary place I have ever stayed. Checked out as soon as possible and stayed at the Pacific Terrace which was much better. You could not pay me to stay at the Beach Haven again. What a way to (--) my mothers day gift to my mom. GETTO!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother if your with your family”
Reviews.Author: Sparky1751
Reviews.Content: The hotel was affordable and the staff helpful and pleasant. Aside from that, the place was a disaster. The room was cramped and outdated. The first night of our stay the shower head came off and hit me on the head. Everytime we used an electrical outlet, the power in the room dimmed. There is very little insulation between rooms and if you happen to have someone occupying the rooms around you, don't expect to have a nice relaxing rest. During our stay there was a heat wave in San Diego. Although the room was equipped with an A/C unit, I was told that the units did not work and I would have to rely on the ceiling fans. It got rather warm in the room. Overall, the experience was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LisaColumbiaFalls
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed on our vacation and actually extended our stay because we loved the area so much. The rooms are small and very outdated but clean and the staff was wonderful. We were within walking distance of food, drink, beach, everything that you could possibly want.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: zameidal
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on December 16th and was greeted kindly and hospitably by older women in very nice office,,,,Went to the room to settle in an found bathroom cabinets all wood rotted and fixtures corroded. Mattresses had a coating of dirt. We slept on top of the bed and left abruptly in the morning without even showering. It was shocking. The smoke detectors didn't work either. No coffee pot or hair dryer as promised. Terrible experience...

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay in this motel again”
Reviews.Author: Heas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this motel last summer and had a great time. When we were leaving the gm Jose booked us again for this year. He gave us the rate of $129.00 a night and told us we could reserve the room number we wanted. We reserved 3 rooms. When calling to confirm the reservation the Beach Haven didn't have any of our reservations. The girl at the front desk said that theres nothing they could do unless we saved are reservations cards, they were booked thank god we did. Had to call numerous times to speak to someone, the manager would never call back. When we arrived we didn't get the room we were promised. My room was on the top floor with no a/c. The room was extremely hot. There was a small evap. cooler in the kitchen area, which leaked all over the floor. We told the maintance man, all he did was dump the water out. Later I had to get towels because the the floor was soaked. The next day they did give us a new room. A few people we spoke with didn't have working a/c. When expressing my concerns to the manager, he just kept interrupting me. At the end of the conversation he said that he made us a deal on the room and he had people paying $200 a night (way to much for this motel). I took it as we must be second rate.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and near the beach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I took up five rooms, and were very happy with the rates, service, and pool-spa. The staff was kind, accomadating, and friendly. Sure, it's not the Ritz, but you get a kitchen with a fridge, stove,pots and pans, and don't pay 200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Location Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: moespice
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Beach Haven Inn and was surprised at how much we enjoyed our stay after reading some of the reviews on here. The staff and location are unbeatable!! the rooms could use some updating - but you get what you pay for. the location to Garnet street ( resturants, bars, shops) and the beach was great. we were there for the Pacific Beach Annual Block Party which is a busy and crazy time and we had no compliants! i would suggest staying here if you want a laid back place with a great location and value. if you are looking for down comforters, 24 hour room service and at least $100 more a night then choose a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We(two couples) arrived at the hotel without having previous knowledge of the hotel site other than pictures on the internet. We arrived after dark, and having reserved two rooms, were told there was only one available and they were sorry. I had verified our two room reservations three different times before we traveled to California and insisted they find a way to accomodate us as one of our members was handicapped and needed his own bathroom. After much phoning, we were given a managers room. The rooms were clean but badly in need of updating....our refrigerator was rusted on the bottom, and the room dishes and pots and pans were dirty and had to be washed before using. The staff was pleasant, and the rate we paid, altho being told it was quoted as rediculously low, was all that should have been charged for the condition the rooms were in.There is no convenient hotel parking, especially annoying when having to carry large bags and a food chest! There also is no elevator. Parking is around the corner or in the back...not too handy for elderly people. No beach can be seen from this hotel, you walk about two blocks behind the building to get to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting with a touch of thievery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. Not clean at ALL! Pillow cases and bed sheets had I think blood stains on them. Air conditioner/heater didn't work so we had to use a space heater to heat the room. On top of that, we checked out early to catch an early flight and NO attendant at the front desk. So my associate and I just placed the room key back on top of the TV and to my surprise today, my checking account was automatically deducted another $75. Shady place......don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modest but nice for price”
Reviews.Author: mugsiewugsie
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough on a recent visit to hot, humid San Diego (yes, it gets that way fairly often during the summer) to stay in a suite at the Beach Haven Inn in Pacific Grove. It's a very modest little place about one block from the beach and, unlike many places nearby, it has great air conditioning!! Nothing fancy, just comfortable queen size bed, good shower, comfortable living area and kitchen...The people who run the place are very nice and accommodating. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: GuitarMain
Reviews.Content: It's a two-star hotel with a 4-star experience. I've stayed at posher places in San Diego, but settled here on Labor Day weekend because it was close to the beach. To my surprise, I really enjoyed my stay. You can't beat the location and value. The staff was very nice and everyone I met was very friendly. I didn't feel fenced in like I would at a big fancy hotel. I even invited friends who lived in the area over to have a poolside BBQ. It was like home. Yes, the girls downstairs from AZ were a little noisy when they got back from the bars, but it added to the atmosphere! I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love Beach Haven! This was my 2nd time here and I loved it. No, it is not the Hilton, but yes, it is a great bargain. The staff was wonderful, the other people staying there are always sooo nice, and the room was perfect for 6 girls! Right across from the popular Garnet Street and a block away from PB. We were up all night and never had any problems! And trust me, we were loud!!! Continental breakfast is only muffins and pastries, but when you're partying like us, the last thing you want in the morning is breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Too close for comfort....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like thin walls, creaky floors, hot water that wont last an entire shower, electricty outages when running the hair dryer, TV, and lamp, parking not close to the room, then this is the place to stay. The room was at least comortable as it contained all the necessities and only a block away from the beach. Although it was in a great location and only a minute from the beautiful beaches of PB, we could only fathom ourselves enduring such a stay for the interim of a few days. Granted, the exterior was very quaint, appeared to be remodeled. We were in a room at the end of the hotel so we were right next to the dumpster. We were hardly ever there so the trip was a very fun adventure nonetheless, but the paper- thin walls and floors/ceiling were about as much as we could take considering that we were on the first floor. One final comment: You definitely get what you pay for; great bargain for a weekend stay, but not for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid spring break, but otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: twowheelsReno
Reviews.Content: A decent enough place: rooms are clean, location can't be beat, price is right, staff is nice. Don't make the mistake of going there (or anywhere near Pacific Beach, for that matter!) during Spring Break, though, unless you're there to party :-) Don't waste your time at the "continental" breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great value! I looked for days before finding this gem. Clean and simple rooms just a block from the beach, with most rooms going for under $100. Family-run and super-friendly staff upgraded me to the suite level for the same price (I didn't even have to ask!), although it was January (slow season). Likewise, did not have traffic noise; I asked for a room off the street. Continental breakfast was negligible, so unless you like packaged pastries, head down the street for a bagel or coffee--there are lots of options, and the area is pedestrian-friendly. Yes, the rooms were a little beat up in the details (e.g., linoleum in bathroom was coming up at the edge in places), but nothing serious, and certainly worth putting up with to pay LESS THAN HALF the price of what most hotels in the immediate area charge. A great choice for the budget-minded traveler who wants a clean, simple room and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: heymossy
Reviews.Content: My family really liked this place. Sure the rooms are a bit dated but everything was clean enough. We had a suite with a fully separate bedroom. The kitchen is small but serviceable. The appliances all looked like refuges from the 70?s but everything worked. But the atmosphere is special. The pool is wonderful. Fully heated and beautifully enclosed in the hotel?s courtyard. The beach is only about a minute away and you don?t have to cross any roads to get to it.All in all the Beach Haven is a great place if you want to relax in San Diego close to the water. I know we?ll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the first week of October. We had the 1 bedroom suite that in the picture is 2nd floor all the way to the right. It is probably the best room and looks just like the pictures. While I have to admit the place is older and not top notch, it is very much like having a small apartment very close to the beach. DO NOT expect anything fancy or luxury, but instead a welcoming home like atmosphere. Things not to like - no view of the water (we knew this before we went just pointing it out). No snack machine, there is a soda machine and an ice machine, but snacks you'll have to go get. The continental breakfast is nothing special, but hey, it's free. (Unlike local calls) In our room specifically, the refrigerator was rusting on the inside, and that is my biggest complaint. We also had an old TV which worked fine but had no captions. Definately do not get the room on the second floor all the way to the left, it sticks out into the alley (at that is your view instead of the pool). Parking can be a little tight, and it may take a trip around the building to find a space. Also, PB is a great neighborhood, but there are a lot homeless people (who are generally harmless) around. Things to like - The place is very clean, and housekeeping, bless them, even did the dishes if we left them. The furniture is comfortable, and there are lots of extra blankets and pillows if you don't need the sleeper sofa beds. The shower has good water pressure and hot water lasts at least 30 minutes a shot (I take this long so I know for sure). It has A/C but open windows can really get a good breeze coming through the unit. The pool and hot tub were nice and warm, if standard, and the staff was very pleasant. (Other guests are friendly too, be sure to say Hi in passing) It's close enough to Garnet (5 blocks) to walk, but far enough away to be away from the party atmosphere. A public beach access is almost directly behind the hotel, with requiste good sand and nearby life guard stand. The Cystal Pier is really close - a must see. Also try Taco Surf (Surf Taco?) which is 1 block away. In all, it's good place to stay if you are not looking for high end, but are looking for clean, comfortable, and close to the water without an outrageous price.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on a highway.”
Reviews.Author: Liketotravel2thesun
Reviews.Content: This is called an "inn", but it's just a motel. The beds were soft and sunken and the sheets had holes in them. Towels were shabby. Peeling paint and (sorry about this), dried snot on the curtains. Don't stay here unless you don't mind listening to the constant sound of traffic 24 hours a day, and every intimate part of every conversation with the people in the next room, just to stay one block from the beach. Pacific Beach is very nice and I'll go back, but I won't go back to the Beach Haven Inn. The people who work there were very nice and I mean them no harm, but this place needs some TLC and updating badly.

HotelInfo.Name: Beach Haven Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 4740 Mission Blvd, San Diego, CA 92109
